column4: I had to reinstall ubuntu after gnome 3 failed to run properly on this laptop.... on my desktop however it flies @klown, just don't blame us when it doesn't work.
I highly recommend trying it klown if you don't mind tinkering... however, just like they've said previously... not fully supported, I'd say wait till oneiric is a bit more stable.
Well there is a way to back up, depending on how you do the install
for some ppa-purge fixed it... others... no.
I'd recommend a reinstall or recovery if things goterible.
Anyone know why an AMD computer with an AMD vision setup on Natty Narwhal would be... "Laggy" ?
I may try it, the look of some of the new gnome3 shells are pretty nice.  Would def make it worth it.  I'm sure upgrading later would require a full install.
you might want to try doing what I do from now on if you're a bit familiar with linux, and keep a seperate home partition.
That way all your really vital files remain intact.
thats a good idea..Maybe I'll try it if gnome 3 breaks :P
It's good for tinkering and if and when stuff breaks, you don't have to go oh crap! where's my backup.
I'm getting terrible lag on an ATI/AMD system with 4gigs of ram =/
videos are choppy and there's an obvious delay with typing and stuff actually apppearing on screen...
It wouldn't be a big deal if this wasn't being built as an arcade machine.
I'm sure it's the gfx card itself
